feed.title: Fraudsters
feed.subtitle: Fraudsters is an all-you-can-eat buffet of liars, cheaters, and scammers. Hosts Seena Ghaznavi and Justin Williams cover every flavor of fraud you can imagine from fake psychic hotlines to corporations cookin’ the books.

entry.title: Episode 15: Kevin Trudeau Part 2 – A Colonic a Day Keeps the Doctor
entry.content: In Part II of our series on the notorious infomercial scammer Kevin Trudeau we cover how to lose 300 pounds in 30 minutes, go to prison sleep-away camp, and get a presidential pardon! / Special thanks to Howard Beales, Former Director of the Bureau of Consumer Protection at the FTC, for a wonderful conversation.

entry.title: Episode 14: Kevin Trudeau Part I — How to Get Banned from Infomercials
entry.content: In Part I of our series on the notorious infomercial scammer Kevin Trudeau we cover how to give yourself mega-memory, break any addiction 100% of the time, and all the other things THEY don't want you to know about!

entry.title: Episode 13: Fraud Reich Part II – The Good Ole “Spear of Destiny”
entry.content: In part I of Fraud Reich we brought you historical fiction—the story of the Hitler Diaries. Today we bring you a sci-fi thriller featuring Adolph Hitler, Hans Loads, David Bowie, and a fraudster named Trevor Ravenscroft. We’re talking the “Spear of Destiny”— the alleged source of Hitler’s power and rot. Special thanks to Marcus Parks, founding father of the Last Podcast Network, for a magical interview.

entry.title: Episode 12: Fraud Reich Part I – Hitler Fan Fiction (that everyone believed)
entry.content: Dear Diary, Many historically significant figures generate lore. Some say Shakespeare didn't write his plays. Some say Nikola Tesla designed blueprints for a "death ray" before his passing. Some say Thomas Jefferson drank breast milk! Few theories, however, are as wild and as widely entertained as the Hitler Diaries were. On the 12th episode of Fraudsters Season 1, we talk where the myth began and how it snowballed into 62 forged Hitler diaries lauded as true by some of the foremost historians and news outlets in Europe. So excited to share this episode with all the Spotifites out there. Love, Seena, Justin, Hazel, and Marie PS: I made up the breast milk myth

entry.title: Episode 11: Al Flores Breaks the Internet… in 1999
entry.content: Remember when we actually said "world wide web?" Remember netscape? Remember the dot-com bubble? Remember Y2K? Remember when a car dealership company said it had the cure for AIDS and sold stocks for $9 through early internet message boards until someone from the FTC commented "hey, this isn't real?" No? On this weeks episode of Fraudsters we bring you Alfred Flores and Uniprime – a con on a .com two decades ago. / Special thanks to John Reed Stark, cyber-cop extraordinaire, for a wonderful and nostalgic interview. / Special thanks to Joshua Sutherland for composing music for this episode.

entry.title: Episode 10: Anna Sorokin Part II – Millenial Icarus
entry.content: The second installment of our two part mini-series on Anna Sorokin. We get into Anna's apprehension, the circus of the trial, and Anna's own reflections from Rikers. / Special thanks to Emily Palmer for being such a wonderful guide throughout this series. You can find Emily on all social at @emilyepalmer. Special thanks to Todd Spodek a delightful interview. Special thanks to Joshua Sutherland for music for this episode.

entry.title: Episode 9: Anna Sorokin Part I – Gossip Girl as Directed by Aaron Sorkin (no relation)
entry.content: The first installment of our two part mini-series on Anna Delvey // Anna Sorokin.

entry.title: Episode 8: PTL and Jim Bakker Part III – Joining Gangs and Curing Coronavirus
entry.content: Our final episode of the mini-series we walk you through justice finally being served in the case of Jim Bakker: How he went to prison for 25 years and came out as a reformed man who lived a quiet, secular life back in Michigan. / Just kidding! He barely went to prison and wasn't humbled by it at all. / On this final episode we spend more time talking about an incarcerated Jim Bakker than he spent in prison. We get into his prison hustles, his strange choice of friends, his post-release shenanigans and reflect on the series as a whole.

entry.title: Episode 7: PTL and Jim Bakker Part II – Finding Jesus, Pissing off Korea, and Falling from Grace
entry.content: Part 2 of our mini-series on Praise the Lord and Jim Bakker. / Special thanks to Joshua Sutherland for always making amazing music for us.

entry.title: Episode 6: PTL and Jim Bakker Part I - WAP for Christians
Episode 5: Jacob Wohl Part II – Wohlin', Trollin,' and Taking Advantage
entry.content: In part 2 of our mini-series on Jacob Wohl, we pivot to his political frauds–covering his ploys to defame Dr. Fauci, Elizabeth Warren, and even Mayor Pete. While just as ludicrous as his earlier financial crimes, his political schemes seem to lack conviction–both in the sense that he no longer seems invested in sustaining charades longer than it takes to create chaos and / because he isn't held responsible for them. / Special thanks to Nancy Rommelmann for a delightful interview.

entry.title: Episode 4: Jacob Wohl – The Wohl Story (it’s mostly fiction!)
entry.content: What did you do as a teenager–jump rope? AIM your crush? Listen to Green Day on your cool new iPod classic? Going out on a limb, but we bet you weren't engaging in elaborate schemes to defraud people of their life savings! Just a guess. Our latest mini-series features Jacob Wohl–a Gen Z scammer who's gone through fraudulent business ventures faster than a normal teen goes through acne cream. On this episode we look at his financial frauds from deceptive hedgefunds to real–FAKE–estate companies, break down the bizarre business practices with an actual finance expert, and sing. Yes... we sing. All that and more on this episode of FRAUDDDSSSTTTERSS. / Special thanks to: Simon TaufiQue for composing the amazing new theme music for Fraudsters. Joshua Sutherland for composing awesome music for this episode. Kai Elwood-Dieu for developing a killer website for this episode.

entry.title: Episode 3: The Psychic Readers Network Part III - Three White Guys and a Pizza Place
entry.content: In our final chapter on The Psychic Readers Network we celebrate never having to spell that word again. Just kidding! In our final episode of the mini-series, Justin and Seena unspin the web of lies and liars at the top of the notorious P.R.N. to unearth one lone pizza box. / Tune in for more. / Special thanks to Joshua Sutherland for composing music for this episode.

entry.title: Episode 2: The Psychic Readers Network Part II - Great Fraud, Bad Psychics, Rich Dudes
entry.content: In part II of our mini-series on the The Psychic Readers Network, Seena and Justin commune with a retired phone psychic and a former director of the Bureau of Consumer Protection to fill in the blanks on Miss Cleo and the PRN.

entry.title: Episode 1: The Psychic Readers Network Part I – CLEO 2020
entry.content: It’s crime! It’s funny! It’s true-cromedy! In this pilot episode of Fraudsters, hosts Seena Ghaznavi and Justin Williams will take you back in time to revisit Miss Cleo and the Psychic Readers Network to find out how they swindled people out of millions, one fake reading at a time.
